info.title: Calligram API
info.description:
## Calligram API: natural language API search and interfacing as a service.
Calligram provides an API that exposes functionality for using natural language to interface with any REST API. For examples and helper, code see [Calligram Documentation](https://github.com/Shelby-Company-Ltd/Calligram-Documentation).

post.description: Return a map of specified API parameter ids to extracted values from an arbitrary natural language query.

403.description: API key information is missing or invalid.

requestBody.description: A map parameters endpoint request body consisting of a list of API parameter objects and a natural language query.

x-codeSamples.source:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("y7xqsccv49.execute-api.us-west-1.amazonaws.com")

payload = "{\"query\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{\"id\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"example\":0,\"requires\":[\"string\"],\"excludes\":[\"string\"],\"values\":[0]}]}"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'x-api-key': "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/production/map", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://y7xqsccv49.execute-api.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/production/map",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"query\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{\"id\":\"string\",\"description\":\"string\",\"example\":0,\"requires\":[\"string\"],\"excludes\":[\"string\"],\"values\":[0]}]}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "content-type: application/json",
    "x-api-key: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://y7xqsccv49.execute-api.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/production/map');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders([
  'content-type' => 'application/json',
  'x-api-key' => 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'
]);

$request->setBody('{"query":"string","description":"string","parameters":[{"id":"string","description":"string","example":0,"requires":["string"],"excludes":["string"],"values":[0]}]}');

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

<?php

$client = new http\Client;
$request = new http\Client\Request;

$body = new http\Message\Body;
$body->append('{"query":"string","description":"string","parameters":[{"id":"string","description":"string","example":0,"requires":["string"],"excludes":["string"],"values":[0]}]}');

$request->setRequestUrl('https://y7xqsccv49.execute-api.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/production/map');
$request->setRequestMethod('POST');
$request->setBody($body);

$request->setHeaders([
  'content-type' => 'application/json',
  'x-api-key' => 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'
]);

$client->enqueue($request)->send();
$response = $client->getResponse();

echo $response->getBody();

success.description: Whether or not the request completed successfully.

result.description: The generated map of API parameter ids to values extracted from the natural language query.

success.description: Whether or not the request completed successfully.

description.description: A natural language description of the endpoint for which parameters are being generated.

parameters.description: A list of API parameters to parse from the request.

example.description: An example value of the API parameter.

requires.description: A list of any other API parameters that must be parsed if this parameter is parsed.

excludes.description: A list of any other API parameters that must not be parsed if this parameter is parsed.

values.description: In case an API parameter can only take on a set of values, the full enumeration of possible values. All enumeration values must be of the same type. If the enumeration values are simple types (not objects), `Map Parameters` will return one of the provided values. If the enumeration values are objects, `Map Parameters` will return the id of the selected enumeration value.

simpleEnumerationValue.description: A valid simple enumeration value for an API parameter.

mappedEnumerationValue.description: A valid mapped enumeration value for an API parameter.

id.description: The id of the API parameter enumeration value.

description.description: The API parameter enumeration value description .

taxonomicEnumerationValue.description: A valid taxonomic enumeration value for an API parameter.

id.description: The id of the API parameter enumeration value.

description.description: The API parameter enumeration value description. If id is self descriptive, description should have the same value.

parents.description: The ids of the parents enumeration values of the API parameter enumeration value.
